segment.documentation: BGM, A segment for unique identification of the Remittance Advice Message, the type of Remittance Advice and its function.
DTM, A segment specifying the dates, and when relevant, the times related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to specify the message date as allocated by the sender.
RFF, A segment for referencing documents which relate to the whole message.

FII, A segment identifying the financial institution (e.g. bank) and account number and, where relevant, the currency of the account, for each party involved in the transaction. The Payor may indicate the previously agreed choice of financial institution for payment.
PAI, A segment specifying the conditions, guarantee, method and channel of payment for the Remittance Advice.

FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying the parties involved in the transaction and, optionally the contact points and numbers.

segment.documentation:
NAD, A segment to identify a party name and address, either by coded identification or in clear form.
It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified e.g. the Buyer and Seller are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the contact person or department for a trading party and specifying the communication channel and number.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department and their function, to whom communications should be directed.
COM, A segment specifying the communication channel and number for the specified contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments specifying the currencies and related dates/periods valid for the whole Remittance Advice. Currency data may be omitted in national applications but will be required for international transactions.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currencies required in the Remittance Advice. A rate of exchange may be given to convert a reference currency into a target currency.
DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the rate of exchange. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments providing details of all documents, e.g. invoices, statements, despatch advices, etc, to which the Remittance Advice refers. It includes information on the monetary amounts for each document and on any adjustments (with an indication of the reason for adjustments) and discounts. For information purposes an indication of the tax element can be provided.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment for identifying the reference document against which payment is being made.
MOA, A segment giving the monetary amounts for the amount due and the amount to be remitted.
DTM, A segment to specify the date of the referenced document and to indicate any other relevant dates applicable, e.g. Due date, Tax point date, etc.
RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any additional references related to the reference document.
NAD, A segment to identify a party name and address, either by coded identification or in a clear form, e.g; original seller or issuer of the document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments specifying the currencies and the related dates/periods valid of the referenced document where different to the remittance currency.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currency and associated exchange rate of the referenced document where different to the remittance currency.
DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to indicate adjustment amounts and their referenced documents.

segment.documentation: AJT, A segment indicating any adjustments to the amounts originally specified in the referenced document, and to which items such adjustments apply, with the associated reason for adjustment.
MOA, A segment giving the monetary amounts of the adjustments of each reference document (e.g. original amount, discount amount, etc). The currency data elements should not be used.
RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any additional references related to the reference document.
FTX, A segment giving information in clear text when it is necessary.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to indicate instructions to parties in coded and when necessary in free text.

segment.documentation: INP, A segment to indicate instructions to parties in coded form.
FTX, A segment to indicate instructions to parties in free text.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments which may be used when required to provide details of individual line items in the reference document.

segment.documentation: DLI, A segment identifying a specific line item within the referenced document.
MOA, A segment giving the monetary amounts for the amount due and the amount to be remitted.
PIA, A segment specifying item identification codes where required.
DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the line item, e.g. date of receiving of the goods, delivery date.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments identifying the currency and the related dates/periods of the line item where different to the remittance and document currency.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment identifying the currency and associated exchange rate of the line item, where different to the remittance and document currency.
DTM, A segment specifying the date/time/period related to the rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to indicate adjustment amounts and their referenced documents for this line item.

segment.documentation: AJT, A segment indicating any adjustments to the amounts originally specified for this line item and the reason for the adjustments.
MOA, A segment giving the monetary amounts of the adjustment for this line item.
RFF, A segment for the inclusion of any additional references related to the reference document.

FTX, A segment giving a complement of information to adjustment reasons for cases that cannot be given (completely) in coded values. 4.1.3 Summary section Information to be provided in the Summary section:
UNS, A service segment placed at the start of the summary section to avoid segment collision.

MOA, A segment giving the total amount of the payment to be made or other amounts. It is taken as given, i.e. is not subject to recalculation. It may be used for check operations, such as message validation.
